name: anode production, for metal electrolysis | anode, for metal electrolysis | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5436/documentation

[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

The activity starts with the reception of the raw materials at the plant gate.

Includes anode production (with it's plant), transports of materials to the plant and the disposal of the wastes.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/279:Manufacture of other electrical equipment/2790:Manufacture of other electrical equipment

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Some Swiss datasets are used for European processes.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology for the aluminium consumed in Europe (85% prebaked, 15% Söderberg
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: see Geography This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature, (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Assumed to have the same data as for anode, aluminium electrolysis / GLO. The process starts with unloading of process materials to their storage areas on site. It includes the processes: recovery of spent anode materials, anode mix preparation, anode block or briquette forming and baking, rodding of baked anodes, maintenance and repair of plant and equipment and treatment of process air, liquids and solids. The process ends when the output (rodded anodes or briquettes) is ready to be transported to an electrolysis plant (primary aluminium smelter). It is assumed that only the total water use is reported and that 80% is used as cooling water and 20% is used as process water.
